clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Qualification Study of Electroencephalographic Mobile Equipment for the Capture of Emotions
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Qualification Study of Electroencephalographic Mobile Equipment for the Capture of Emotions

brief_summary.textblock: The study aim to determine the reliability of various EEG wireless headsets. Their signal will be compared to standard high-density EEG recording during music listening.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality and spatial/temporal coherence in oscillatory responses patterns recorded with EEG wireless headsets (Emotiv and g.tec) and with the EEG high density gold standard
primary_outcome.description: Brain activity will be recorded continuously during musical extract listening. The coherence of EEG activity between the three different devices on similar electrodes will be measured and compared for several brainwaves (delta, theta, alpha, beta, gamma)

arm_group.description: Participants are listening to music while their neural activity is recorded with Emotiv Epoc+
Participants are listening to music while their neural activity is recorded with g.tec
Participants are listening to music while their neural activity is recorded with high density 256 electrodes EEG Geodesic

intervention.description: Cerebral measurements from electroencephalography devices while music is presented to the participant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Right handed healthy people
- sensitive to "music chill" (Barcelona Reward music Questionnaire>50)
- having given their participation agreement
- individual with health insurance coverage.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- individuals in "exclusion period" of another study
- subjects with auditory deficits
